sentences.eng: My neighbor is a policeman.
He works in Moscow,
but he lives in Pushkino.
He gets up early, at 5 o’clock,
and runs to the railway-station.
He usually sleeps in the suburban train.
Then he stands on one leg in the crowded underground carriage.
sentences.rus: [Потом|потом|then] он [стоит|стоять|to stand] на одной [ноге|нога|a leg] в [переполненном|переполненный|crowded] [вагоне|вагон|a carriage] [метро|метро|underground].

sentences.eng: He comes to work cheerful and rested
sentences.rus: Он [приходит|приходить, приезжать|to come] [на работу|на работу|to work] [бодрый|веселый(ая), бодрый(ая)|cheerful] и [отдохнувший|отдохнувший|rested]

sentences.eng: and begins to catch criminals immediately.

sentences.eng: He usually catches thieves at Sheremetyevo Airport.
sentences.rus: [Обычно|обычно|usually] он [ловит|ловить|to catch] [воришек|вор, воришка|a thief] в [аэропорту|аэропорт|airport] Шереметьево.

sentences.eng: He works fast, professionally and with pleasure.
My neighbor is married.
His wife works in the police too.
But she isn’t a police officer,
she is a secretary.
She is a very experienced secretary.
She speaks English fluently
and she often communicates by skype with her co-workers from America.
